bill_title: restrict the reasons for which a candidate may withdraw from a nomination.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict the reasons for which a candidate may withdraw from a nomination. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-6-55 be amended to read as follows: 12-6-55. Any person nominated in a primary election to any elective office who is subsequently selected by a state party convention as a candidate for state office pursuant to § 12- 5-21 or any person nominated in a primary election who no longer resides in the state, county, or district in which the candidate was nominated may cause his name to be withdrawn from withdraw from the nomination by request in writing, subscribed and sworn to by him the person before any officer qualified to administer oaths and take acknowledgments. The request shall be filed with the officer with whom the nominating petition was filed pursuant to § 12-6-4, not later than the first Tuesday in August at 5:00 p.m. before the ensuing election. No name so withdrawn shall may be printed upon the ballots to be used at such the election. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
